column4: ok so after 7 grueling hours and much help I was advised that my computer boots to ipv6 vs ipv4 and in order for me to get the internet to work properly I have to get ipv4 with dhcp working. after 3 hours of researching I have come to nothing but dead ends is there anyone who can help? please i've been trying to get internet for 10 hours :( i'm currently on another laptop
http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-how-to-disable-the-ipv6-protocol.html
i am stupid and this is the first time I have ever used linux
i've never disbaled ipv6 myself. just trying to give you a web page that shows how
you can use whatever editor you want, you don't have to use 'vi'
I don't know what your talking about don;t I just type this in terminal?
pretty close... what that web page says. yes,except one thing, as a newuser you aren't going to wanttobe using 'vi'. do this one the command line instead...   gksu  ...then type in --> gedit
i'm afraid I'm too stupid to understand your help

sorry typo's. let me put that back in...   pretty close... what that web page says. yes, except one thing, as a new user you aren't going to want to be using 'vi'. do this on the command line instead...   gksu  ...then type in --> gedit    (my blasted space bar, lol)
I'm lost what is vi?
vi is a text editor
so is gedit
ok I cannot follow your help lol
it sounds like your friend from china has not done you a favor by leaving you high and dry after installing linux on your machine.
how come you can't copy and paste?
your on a different computer i take it
it's only because wireless is still fairly new territory for linux
hello there
Lol!
if you keep using linux, you can expect to have some hours like that. however, eventually, you'll get over the hump
some more*
well, to set a desktop background i just use System --> Preferences --> Appearance --> Background(Tab)
you can also install and use a command line app called 'feh'
